steps.title: Coordinate placement and known lengths
steps.content: Let plane α be z = 0. Choose A′ = (−3,0,0), B′ = (3,0,0); then A and B, whose projections are A′ and B′ respectively with |AB| = |A′B′| = 6, must lie at a common height h above α: A = (−3,0,h), B = (3,0,h). Their midpoint is M = (0,0,h) with projection M′ = (0,0,0). Point P lies on α with PM′ ⟂ A′B′ and |PM′| = 6, so P = (0,6,0).

steps.title: Determine height using projected area
steps.content: Triangle A′B′P in α has area ½·6·6 = 18. Plane α has normal nα = (0,0,1); plane ABP has normal nβ = AB × AP = (0,6h,36). The cosine of the angle between the planes is |nα·nβ| / (|nα||nβ|) = 36 / (6√(h²+36)) = 6 / √(h²+36). The orthogonal projection of triangle A′B′P onto plane ABP has area 18·(6/√(h²+36)), given to be 9/2. Solving gives √(h²+36) = 24 ⇒ h = 6√15.

steps.title: Compute |PM|
steps.content: Vector PM = M − P = (0,0,h) − (0,6,0) = (0,−6,6√15). Thus |PM| = √(36 + 540) = √576 = 24, corresponding to choice ⑤.

steps.title: Establish coordinates for key points
steps.content: Place A' at origin (0, 0, 0) and B' at (6, 0, 0) on plane α. Since AB is parallel to α with the same length as A'B', we have A = (0, 0, h) and B = (6, 0, h) for some height h > 0. The midpoint M of AB is at (3, 0, h), and M' (projection of M onto α) is at (3, 0, 0), which is also the midpoint of A'B'.

steps.title: Locate point P
steps.content: Since PM' ⊥ A'B' and PM' = 6, and A'B' is along the x-axis, P must be at (3, 6, 0) or (3, -6, 0). We choose P = (3, 6, 0) without loss of generality.

steps.title: Calculate area of triangle A'B'P
steps.content: Triangle A'B'P has vertices A'(0,0,0), B'(6,0,0), P(3,6,0). Base A'B' = 6, and the perpendicular height from P to line A'B' is PM' = 6. Area of triangle A'B'P = (1/2) × 6 × 6 = 18.

steps.title: Apply projection area formula
steps.content: The projection of triangle A'B'P onto plane ABP has area 9/2 (given). Using the projection formula: Area of projection = Area × |cos θ| where θ is the dihedral angle between the planes. So: 9/2 = 18 × |cos θ|, which gives |cos θ| = 1/4.

steps.title: Find normal vectors to both planes
steps.content: Plane α (containing A'B'P) has normal n₁ = (0, 0, 1). For plane ABP with vertices A(0,0,h), B(6,0,h), P(3,6,0): Vector AB = (6, 0, 0), Vector AP = P - A = (3, 6, -h).
